result.markdown:
---
title: "Regression (II)"
author: "Gani Cem Türemen"
---


# Challenge Summary

Our goal is to figure out what gaps exist in the products of a bike manufacturer and come up with a pricing algorithm that will help us to determine a price, if we were to come up with products in that product category.

# Objectives

Apply your knowledge on regression on a business case. You will specifically apply:

- Modeling: `parsnip`
- Pre-processing: `recipes` and `rsample``
- Bundling the model and recipe: `workflows`
- Evaluation: `yardstick`
- Visualization : `ggplot2`

# Solution

## Import Libraries


::: {.cell hash='03_regression_ii_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_ba183c2abdd1f0a4b8b2b17a2cfe2601'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)  
library(parsnip)  
library(recipes)  
library(rsample)
library(workflows)
library(yardstick)
```
:::


## Read Data


::: {.cell hash='03_regression_ii_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_b5ba274f0a43df89de2ebaa6ddc7895d'}

```{.r .cell-code}
bike_orderlines_tbl <- readRDS(
  "~/GitHub/ss23-bdml-gcturemen/code_drafts/data/bike_orderlines.rds")

bike_features_tbl <- readRDS(
  "~/GitHub/ss23-bdml-gcturemen/code_drafts/data/bike_features_tbl.rds")

bike_orderlines_tbl %>% glimpse()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> Rows: 15,644
#> Columns: 18
#> $ order_id       <dbl> 1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 4, 5, 5, 5, 5, 6, 6, 6, 6, 7…

#> $ order_date     <dttm> 2015-01-07, 2015-01-07, 2015-01-10, 2015-01-10, 2015-0…

#> $ url            <chr> "https://www.canyon.com/en-de/mountain-bikes/trail-bike…

#> $ location       <chr> "Hamburg, Hamburg", "Hamburg, Hamburg", "Bremen, Bremen…

```
:::
:::


## Data Exploration

We will visualize the data to determine possible product gaps. It would be interesting to see the sales for each `category_2` separated by the frame material. However, we do not have the sales number. Instead, we will use the stock numbers as a proxy:

::: {.cell hash='03_regression_ii_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_03f52dc775e5e79ec663cff89ab053c9'}

```{.r .cell-code}
model_num_sold_tbl <- bike_orderlines_tbl %>% 
  select(quantity, model) %>%
  group_by(model) %>%
  summarise(num_sold = sum(quantity)) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  arrange(desc(num_sold))

model_sales_tbl <- bike_orderlines_tbl %>% 
  select(total_price, model, category_2, frame_material) %>% 
  group_by(model, category_2, frame_material) %>%
  summarise(revenue = sum(total_price)) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  arrange(desc(revenue))

model_sales_tbl <- model_sales_tbl %>% 
  inner_join(model_num_sold_tbl)

model_sales_tbl
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='03_regression_ii_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_82a0f31b589ec731a629bb1e0732fea4'}

Visualizing the `model_sales_tbl`:

::: {.cell hash='03_regression_ii_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_49e5ecd43cd4d9fcb2703e8c4350bd43'}

```{.r .cell-code}
model_sales_tbl %>% 
  mutate(category_2 = as_factor(category_2) %>% 
           fct_reorder(revenue, .fun = max) %>% 
           fct_rev()) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(frame_material, revenue)) +
  geom_violin() +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.1, alpha = 0.5, color = "#2DC6D6") +
  facet_wrap(~ category_2) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::dollar_format(scale = 1e-6, 
                                                    suffix = "M", 
                                                    accuracy = 0.1)) +
  labs(title = "Total Sales for Each Model",
    x = "Frame Material", y = "Revenue") +
  theme(
    panel.background = element_rect(fill = "#222222"),
    panel.border = element_rect(color = "white", fill = NA),
    plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#222222"),
    line = element_line(color = "white"),
    text = element_text(color = "white"),
    axis.ticks = element_line(color = "white"),
    axis.text = element_text(color = "white")
  )
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](03_regression_ii_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Create the model


::: {.cell hash='03_regression_ii_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_9b9e3001d4a5522d228dca710616c904'}

```{.r .cell-code}
linear_model <- 
  linear_reg("regression") %>%
  set_engine("lm")
```
:::


## Split the data


::: {.cell hash='03_regression_ii_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_a35998be1ac4c6d5f1b3fb90c4a6bef4'}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(1036)
split_obj <- initial_split(bike_features_tbl, prop = 0.80, strata = "category_2")

train_tbl <- training(split_obj)
test_tbl  <- testing(split_obj)

train_tbl <- train_tbl %>%
  set_names(str_replace_all(names(train_tbl), " |-", "_"))
test_tbl  <- test_tbl  %>% 
  set_names(str_replace_all(names(test_tbl),  " |-", "_"))
```
:::


## Create the recipe


::: {.cell hash='03_regression_ii_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_cf7f72b17428185a8dbcde44e05b6cfc'}

```{.r .cell-code}
sales_rec <- 
  recipe(price ~ ., data = train_tbl %>% 
           select(-c(bike_id:model_year),
                  -weight,
                  -category_1,
                  -c(category_3:Fork),
                  -c(Front_Derailleur:Brake_Rotor))) %>%
  step_novel(all_predictors(), -all_numeric()) %>%
  step_dummy(all_nominal(), -all_outcomes(), one_hot = T) %>%
  step_zv(all_predictors()) %>%
  prep()

sales_rec
```

## Create the workflow

Bundle the `linear_model` and `sales_rec` together:

::: {.cell hash='03_regression_ii_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_7dcd4b3bfbeef2934885b50cc474a5bf'}

```{.r .cell-code}
sales_wflow <- 
  workflow() %>% 
  add_model(linear_model) %>% 
  add_recipe(sales_rec)

sales_wflow
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> ══ Workflow ════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
#> Preprocessor: Recipe
#> Model: linear_reg()
#> 
#> ── Preprocessor ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> 3 Recipe Steps
#> 
#> • step_novel()
#> • step_dummy()
#> • step_zv()
#> 
#> ── Model ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> Linear Regression Model Specification (regression)
#> 
#> Computational engine: lm
```
:::
:::


Fit the model to the training data:

::: {.cell hash='03_regression_ii_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-10_478e097698ff33699cd82996effc6c75'}

```{.r .cell-code}
sales_fit <- 
  sales_wflow %>% 
  fit(data = train_tbl)
```
:::


## Evaluate the model




::: {.cell hash='03_regression_ii_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-12_35c5da86b5c1d8a0664980fdae7398f0'}

```{.r .cell-code}
sales_fit %>% 
  calc_metrics(test_tbl)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
